Authors:
Sanna Olsson, Johannes Enroth, Sanna Huttunen, Dietmar
Quandt
Title: Forsstroemia (Neckeraceae) revisited
Keywords:
Leptodon, molecular systematics, Shevockia, pleurocarpous
mosses, taxonomy
Abstract:
The pleurocarpous moss genus Forsstroemia, which belongs
to the family Neckeraceae and was taxonomically revised in 1987, is
revisited. The taxon sampling comprises 10 out of the 12 species that
are recognized in the genus and in addition the recently described
Forsstroemia remotifolia. The revision is based on phylogenetic analyses
using sequence level data from the plastid trnT-(rps4)-trnL-trnF cluster
and rpl16 as well as nuclear ITS1 and 2. Forsstroemia japonica was
placed next to Shevockia inunctocarpa in a clade only remotely related
to Forsstroemia. Thus F. japonica is transferred to Shevockia.
Forsstroemia remotifolia is renamed as Leptodon remotifolius. The other
nine species in Forsstroemia form a monophyletic group, six of the
species being restricted to Asia, one (F. coronata) to South America,
and two (F. producta, F. trichomitria) having a wider distribution. A
previously suggested hybrid origin for F. coronata was not supported by
the sequence data.
